Well, one runthrough in IFOedit and then through DVDshrink, and then a test in VLC. Now I might dare to burn it!

IFOedit protested as well, s there's something wrong with the original torrent.

I'll report on the burning and player testing.....

Burning seems OK in my DVD-player.

But the stripping in IFOedit wasn't childsplay. But I open the IFO file listed just before the bigger VIDEO_TS files and then stripped all I did'nt want. IFOedit made some protests at the end but DVDshrink opened it up nicely.

Sorry, I should have mentioned the compatibility problems with DVD Shrink. I had to use Magic DVD Ripper to rip it. To burn or shrink it you could use Nero 6 Ultra or similar.
How ever, there it is no problem playeing the files from HD.  ;-) Kula

If you want to burn it and you don't want to fuck around to much with the copy protection just use FixVTS on the vob files... i used it and after 10 minutes or so i could rip it in dvdshrink... ^_^

direct link to the program:
http://www.afterdawn.com/software/dawnload.cfm?mirror_id=0&version_id=1724&software_id=831

direct link to some lite info on the program:
http://www.afterdawn.com/software/video_software/dvd_tools/fixvts.cfm

It's open source so it's FREE... ^_^

Later dudes.

Thanks Kahonda!
FixVTS gets the job done.
I will make sure to use it BEFORE upload the next time.
:-) Kula
